Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council (Vet.) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp. -PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizing an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of Tangipahoa, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and their surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption (in addition to the homestead exemption authorized under the provisions of Article VII, Section 20 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended (the "Louisiana Constitution"), which applies to the first $7,500 of the assessed valuation of property), be authorized on the next $7,500 of assessed valuation of property receiving the homestead exemption, with respect to property owned and occupied by a veteran with a service-connected disability rating of 100% by the United States Department of Veteran Affairs, and their surviving spouse, on property located in the Parish of Tangipahoa, State of Louisiana, in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption for certain disabled veterans and their surviving spouses shall extend and apply to property in the Parish of Tangipahoa, State of Louisiana only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of the Parish of Tangipahoa, State of Louisiana voting on this proposition?

Race.SpecificTitle: Hammond Dwntwn. Dev. Dist. -- 14.16 Mills - Ham. Dwntwn. Dev. Auth - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Hammond Downtown Development District Proposition
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 14.16 mill tax renewal for the Hammond Downtown Development District, for constructing, renovating, acquiring, operating or maintaining facilities contemplated by the District's redevelopment plan and for the operating expenses of the District, including, without limitation, funding neighborhood grants for residential areas east and west and providing matching funds for inducement of development in the District.
Race.FullText: Shall the Hammond Downtown Development District, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a special tax of fourteen and sixteen hundredths (14.16) mills on all the property subject to taxation within the District (an estimated $168,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023, inclusive, which tax will be subject to homestead exemption as provided by La. R.S. 33:2740.15(E)(3), for the purpose of constructing, renovating, acquiring, operating or maintaining facilities contemplated by the District's redevelopment plan and for the operating expenses of the District, including, without limitation, funding neighborhood grants for residential areas east and west and providing matching funds for inducement of development in the District?
